quotes.quote: Unhappiness is an unfinished state; happy people don't need our help.
All unhappiness is due to the ego. With it comes all your trouble. If you would deny the ego and scorch it by ignoring it you would be free.
All human unhappiness comes from not facing reality squarely, exactly as it is.
All mankind's unhappiness derives from one thing: his inability to know how to remain in repose in one room.
Unhappiness isn't at its most acute point until a realistic chance of happiness, sufficiently close, has been envisioned.
We are sometimes dragged into a pit of unhappiness by someone else's opinion that we do not look happy.
Unhappiness and dissatisfaction with life are not signs of mental illness, but of growing intelligence.
If our life is unhappy it is painful to bear; if it is happy it is horrible to lose, So the one is pretty equal to the other.
The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
Unhappiness is really an incorrect way of seeing. When we are unhappy we don't see life as it really is. We are in a condition of veiled light, of shadows.
The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
You have to fight unhappiness like a dragon with fire and breathe.
Your unhappiness is a way of speaking to you, it's telling you something isn't right.
No one is discontented at not being a king except a discrowned king unhappiness almost invariably indicates the existence of a road not taken, a talent undeveloped, a self not recognized.
The cause of most of man's unhappiness is sacrificing what he wants most for what he wants now.
By becoming more unhappy, we sometimes learn how to be less so.
Unhappiness is not knowing what we want, and killing ourselves to get it.
The unhappy are prisoners of a single round of thought.
Unhappiness is not knowing what we want and killing ourselves to get it.
There is only one cause of unhappiness: the false beliefs you have in your head, beliefs so widespread, so commonly held, that it never occurs to you to question them.
All unhappiness is caused by our trying to be limited, to be an ego. The more we are our Self, the happier we are. We will never be completely happy until we are completely being our Self.
If a man is unhappy, remember that his unhappiness is his own fault, for God made all men to be happy.
Unhappy people often insist on trying to uncover the full magnitude of their unhappiness, or choose to investigate other people's lives as a distraction from their own.
Unhappiness in one place doesn't breed happiness elsewhere. It just breeds more unhappiness.
Unhappiness is something we are never taught about; we are taught to expect happiness, but never a Plan B to use to use when the happiness doesn't arrive.

Unhappiness slowly creeps up on you, like a shape-shifting monster waiting in the darkness of your hallway, his bulging eyes watching your every move. The breath on his slimy tongue makes the hairs on your neck stand up.
Unhappiness indicates wrong thinking, just as ill health indicates a bad regimen.
Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid.
Unhappiness does make people look stupid.
We create our own unhappiness. The purpose of suffering is to help us understand we are the ones who cause it.
